About me

Growing up in Casablanca I have always been enchanted and drawn to the special seasonings and tastes of the Moroccan kitchen. My parents were from the north of Morocco so I have a great appreciation of Spanish cuisine and its influences as well as the finesse and elegance of French cuisine, from the French culture of Casablanca, and from my close family ties in Europe. After making aliyah to Israel I continued to blossom and learn. I embraced the specialties of Israel and the Mediterranean, refining them, and making them my own. I graduated with outstanding achievement from the famous Tadmor culinary institute where I gained a more professional approach and a keener sense of quality and creativity. As part of my personal development I was awarded an internship in Paris, France where I grabbed the opportunity to soak up all that I could and learn the tricks that make a dish elevated. I have also worked as food and beverage controller for the Hilton Tel Aviv hotel. This experience made it clear to me that I am at home professionally and personally suited to the culinary arts and the pleasure that they can bring to people, especially for celebrations, but even for just simple enjoyment. Today the Dallas area is my home and where people have come to know me and my abilities. Dallas.eater.com gave me recognition and acclaim for my sufganiyot (Donuts) during the Hanukkah season of which I am very proud. I offer customized cakes of different styles and designs at reasonable prices, to dessert table catering for private events, to hearty family meals targeted to your personal taste, be it Israeli or Moroccan. When it comes down to it, the quality and love put in to every thing I prepare makes me confident that I will earn a spot in you heart.
